title: Paddy Patterson
text:
Patrick "Paddy" Patterson (born 30 November 1998) is an Irish <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who is currently a member of the <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> academy. He plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Scrum-half">scrum-half</a> and can also cover all positions in the back-three.
Early life.
He attended <a href="Blackrock%20College">Blackrock College</a>, leaving in 2017.
Professional career.
Leinster.
Patterson entered the <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> academy ahead of the 2018–19 season. He made his senior debut in the 2018–19 season, featuring against the Dragons one day after his 20th birthday.
Munster.
Patterson joined Leinster's provincial rivals <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> on a short-term contract in January 2021, where he provided cover for <a href="Craig%20Casey">Craig Casey</a> and <a href="Conor%20Murray">Conor Murray</a>, who were away with the <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> squad for the <a href="2021%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2021 Six Nations</a>, and the injured <a href="Neil%20Cronin">Neil Cronin</a>. He made his debut for Munster in their 28–10 win against Welsh side <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> in round 15 of the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Pro14">2020–21 Pro14</a> on 12 March 2021, coming on as a 65th minute replacement for <a href="Shane%20Daly">Shane Daly</a>, and made his first start for the province in their 31–17 win against Italian side <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton</a> in round 16 one week later, though he was forced to leave the field with an ankle injury in the 37th minute, which subsequently required surgery. Patterson left Leinster to join year three of Munster's academy programme ahead of the 2021–22 season.
Ireland.
Patterson represented the <a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland under-20s</a> at the <a href="2018%20Six%20Nations%20Under%2020s%20Championship">2018 Six Nations Under 20s Championship</a> and at the <a href="2018%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2018 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a>.
